Bacon Burger

Jump to Recipe

If you're on the hunt for the ultimate comfort food, look no further than the classic bacon burger! This mouthwatering recipe combines juicy ground beef with crispy bacon and melty cheddar cheese, creating a burger experience that's hard to resist. Perfect for backyard barbecues, family dinners, or a simple weeknight treat, our bacon burger recipe promises to satisfy your cravings and impress your guests. With just a few fresh ingredients, including crunchy lettuce, ripe tomato, and tangy pickles, you can craft a delicious burger that is as visually appealing as it is tasty. Whether you're a seasoned grill master or a novice in the kitchen, our step-by-step guide will ensure your bacon burgers turn out perfectly every time. So grab your apron and let's dive into the delectable world of bacon burgers!

Ingredients

ground beef

Choose ground beef with a fat content of around 80/20 for a juicy burger. If you prefer a leaner option, use 90/10, but be aware that it may be less juicy. For a flavorful twist, consider using ground turkey or chicken, but adjust cooking times as they may cook faster.

bacon

Use thick-cut bacon for a hearty texture and more flavor. If you're looking for a healthier alternative, turkey bacon or veggie bacon can work, though they will have different cooking times and flavors. For extra flavor, consider marinating the bacon in maple syrup or a spicy rub before cooking.

cheddar cheese

Sharp cheddar adds a nice tang to the burger, but feel free to experiment with other cheeses such as American, Swiss, or pepper jack. For a gourmet touch, try using a cheese with herbs or spices. If you're dairy-free, there are great vegan cheese options available.

burger buns

To enhance flavor, opt for brioche or pretzel buns instead of standard hamburger buns. You can also toast the buns with a little butter or garlic for added richness. If you're gluten-free, there are many gluten-free bun options available that can hold up well to toppings.

lettuce

Romaine or iceberg lettuce provides a nice crunch, but consider using arugula for a peppery flavor or spinach for added nutrients. For a more gourmet burger, try using crispy kale or microgreens.

tomato

Choose ripe, in-season tomatoes for the best flavor. Heirloom varieties can add a unique taste and color. If tomatoes aren't in season, consider using sun-dried tomatoes or roasted red peppers for a different flavor profile.

pickles

Dill pickles are classic, but feel free to experiment with bread and butter or spicy pickles for added sweetness or heat. You can also use pickled jalapeños or even kimchi for a unique twist.

salt

Use kosher salt or sea salt for better flavor distribution. Remember that bacon and cheese are already salty, so start with a small amount and adjust to taste.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper adds the best flavor. For a kick, consider using white pepper or adding a sprinkle of cayenne for heat. If you're concerned about spice, start with a small amount and adjust to your taste.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the cooking surface

    Start by preheating your skillet or grill over medium-high heat. This ensures your burgers cook evenly and develop a nice sear. It's essential for flavor!

  • Step 2: Form the patties

    Take your ground beef and divide it into four equal portions, then shape each portion into a patty about 3/4 inch thick. Use your thumb to create a small indentation in the center of each patty to prevent them from puffing up while cooking. Season generously with salt and pepper on both sides.

  • Step 3: Cook the patties

    Place the seasoned patties on the hot skillet or grill. Cook them for about 4-5 minutes on one side without moving them. This will create a delicious crust. Flip the patties and cook for an additional 4-5 minutes for medium doneness. Adjust the time based on your desired doneness.

  • Step 4: Cook the bacon

    While the burgers are cooking, add the bacon slices to the skillet or grill. Cook alongside the burgers for about 5-7 minutes until they are crispy, flipping halfway through. The bacon fat will also enhance the flavor of the burgers!

  • Step 5: Melt the cheese

    In the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheddar cheese on each burger patty. Cover the skillet or close the grill lid to help the cheese melt perfectly.

  • Step 6: Toast the buns

    Remove the cooked burgers and bacon from the skillet or grill. Place the burger buns cut-side down on the grill or in the skillet for a couple of minutes until they are golden brown and crispy. This step is crucial for adding texture and preventing sogginess.

  • Step 7: Assemble the burgers

    Now it's time to build your burger! Start with the bottom bun, add the cheese-topped patty, followed by the crispy bacon, a leaf of lettuce, a slice of tomato, and pickles. Finally, crown your creation with the top bun and press down gently.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I safely handle raw ground beef?

Always wash your hands before and after handling raw meat. Use separate cutting boards for meat and vegetables to avoid cross-contamination. Store raw ground beef in the refrigerator and cook it within 1-2 days.

How do I know when my burgers are done?

The best way to check if your burgers are done is to use a meat thermometer. Ground beef should reach an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C). If you don’t have a thermometer, cook them until they are no longer pink in the center.

What’s the best way to form burger patties?

Gently shape the ground beef into patties without overworking the meat, which can make them tough. Aim for about ¾-inch thickness and make a small indentation in the center to prevent puffing up while cooking.

How do I cook bacon properly?

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat. Lay the slices flat and avoid overcrowding the pan. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, flipping occasionally, until crispy. You can also bake it in the oven on a baking sheet at 400°F (200°C) for 15-20 minutes.

What can I do if I don’t have burger buns?

You can use any type of bread you have on hand, such as English muffins, pita bread, or even lettuce leaves for a low-carb option. Just make sure they are sturdy enough to hold the burger and toppings.

How can I make my burgers more flavorful?

In addition to salt and pepper, you can mix in herbs, spices, or even sauces into the ground beef before forming patties. Try adding garlic powder, onion powder, or Worcestershire sauce for extra flavor.

What toppings can I add to my burger?

Feel free to get creative! Besides lettuce, tomato, and pickles, you can add onions (raw or grilled), avocado, jalapeños, or different types of cheese. The possibilities are endless!

How do I properly toast burger buns?

To toast burger buns, you can place them cut side down on the grill or in a skillet over medium heat for about 1-2 minutes until golden brown. Keep an eye on them to avoid burning.

What should I do with leftovers?

Store leftover cooked burgers and toppings in airtight containers in the fridge. They should be eaten within 3-4 days. You can reheat the burgers in a skillet or microwave.

What’s the best way to clean up after cooking?

Clean as you go! Wipe down counters and wash utensils and cutting boards right after use. For any stuck-on food, soak pots and pans in hot, soapy water for easier cleaning later.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a healthier option, consider using lean ground turkey or chicken instead of beef. You can also swap out regular bacon for turkey bacon or a plant-based alternative for a lighter and vegetarian-friendly version. Gluten-free buns are available for those with gluten sensitivities, and vegan cheese can replace cheddar for a completely dairy-free option.

Pairings

The Bacon Burger pairs excellently with a variety of sides and beverages. Consider serving it with crispy sweet potato fries or onion rings to add texture and flavor contrast. For beverages, a cold craft lager or a classic cola complements the savory richness of the bacon and beef beautifully. A light-bodied red wine, such as a Pinot Noir, can also enhance the experience while providing a sophisticated touch.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Bacon Burger on a rustic wooden board for a casual, inviting presentation. Consider adding a dollop of specialty sauces like chipotle mayo or garlic aioli for an extra kick. For a gourmet touch, sprinkle some fresh herbs like chives or parsley on top of the assembled burgers. If you're hosting a barbecue or outdoor gathering, consider setting up a toppings bar with additional options like avocado, jalapeños, or a variety of cheeses to let guests customize their burgers.

Bacon Burger

25 min
$12
650 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

WheatDairy

Dietary Tags:

GlutenDairy

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

EasyQuickComfort Food

Occasions:

Casual DiningBBQGame Day

Description

Juicy beef patty topped with crispy bacon, melted cheese, and fresh toppings, all sandwiched between a toasted bun.

Ingredients

  • ground beef: 1 pound
  • bacon: 6 slices
  • cheddar cheese: 4 slices
  • burger buns: 4
  • lettuce: 4 leaves
  • tomato: 1, sliced
  • pickles: 4 slices
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

12/25/2024
